skill.name: create-skill-file
skill.description: Guides Claude in creating well-structured SKILL.md files following best practices. Provides clear guidelines for naming, structure, and content organization to make skills easy to discover and execute.
skill.summary: Guides Claude in creating well-structured SKILL.md files following best practices. Provides clear gu...
skill.author: YYH211

security_audit.summary: This skill is pure documentation that teaches how to write SKILL.md files. All 450 static findings are false positives caused by pattern matching markdown code blocks in documentation examples as executable code. The skill contains no actual executable code, network requests, or credential access - only instructional markdown with code snippets shown as examples.

content.user_title: Create Professional SKILL.md Files with Best Practices
content.value_statement: Writing effective Claude skills requires following specific conventions and structures. This skill provides templates, examples, and guidelines to create discoverable and maintainable SKILL.md files.
actual_capabilities: Provides step-by-step guide for creating SKILL.md files from scratch
Includes ready-to-use templates for basic and workflow skills
Shows good and bad examples with detailed explanations
Explains YAML frontmatter requirements and naming conventions
Offers quality checklist for validating skill completeness
Teaches trigger keyword optimization for skill discovery
limitations: Does not automatically generate SKILL.md files
Requires manual application of guidelines to your specific use case
Examples are primarily in Python and bash contexts
Documentation is partially in Chinese language

use_cases.title: Create your first skill
use_cases.description: Follow the 3-step quick start guide to create a basic SKILL.md file with proper structure and naming conventions.

use_cases.title: Improve skill discoverability
use_cases.description: Learn trigger keyword optimization and description writing techniques to make your skills activate reliably when users need them.

use_cases.title: Standardize team skill development
use_cases.description: Use the provided templates and quality checklists to establish consistent skill authoring practices across your organization.

prompt_templates.title: Quick start
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a basic skill from scratch
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill for [task]. Follow the create-skill-file guidelines.

prompt_templates.title: Use template
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the basic-skill-template to create a skill that helps with [specific task].

prompt_templates.title: Review skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Check existing skill against best practices
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my SKILL.md file against the quality checklist and suggest improvements.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize triggers
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me improve the description and trigger keywords for my [skill-name] skill so it activates more reliably.

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for managing database migrations
output: Creates YAML frontmatter with name 'database-migration' and keyword-rich description
Adds 'When to Use' section with 4 trigger scenarios
Includes step-by-step workflow for creating and applying migrations
Provides code examples showing upgrade and downgrade functions

output_examples.input: Review my skill against best practices
output: Checks name follows lowercase-hyphen format under 64 characters
Verifies description contains trigger keywords and scenarios
Confirms presence of examples with input and output

best_practices: Keep skills focused on information Claude does not already know, like project-specific workflows
Include 3-5 specific trigger scenarios in the 'When to Use' section
Provide at least 2-3 complete examples with actual inputs and expected outputs
anti_patterns: Using vague names like 'helper' or 'utility' that do not describe specific functionality
Writing abstract steps like 'analyze code' without concrete actions or commands
Creating skills over 500 lines without splitting into sub-files

faq.question: How long should a SKILL.md file be?
faq.answer: Ideal length is 200-500 lines. If your skill exceeds 500 lines, split it into sub-files like reference.md and examples.md.

faq.question: How do I make my skill activate more reliably?
faq.answer: Include user-spoken keywords in your description and list specific trigger scenarios in the 'When to Use' section.

faq.question: What should I include in the description field?
faq.answer: Describe what the skill does, include trigger keywords users would say, and mention specific tools or technologies involved.

faq.question: Can I use underscores in skill names?
faq.answer: No. Use lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens only. The name must be 64 characters or less and match the directory name.

faq.question: How often should I update my skills?
faq.answer: Review skills quarterly to update outdated information. Update immediately when dependent tools or APIs change.

faq.question: What if multiple skills have overlapping functionality?
faq.answer: Use more specific descriptions to differentiate them, explain the relationship in 'When to Use', or consider merging into one skill.
